name: form_urlencoded

readme.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate form_urlencodedCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/src/form_urlencoded/lib.rs.html#9-427)
Expand description
Parser and serializer for the [`application/x-www-form-urlencoded` syntax](http://url.spec.whatwg.org/#application/x-www-form-urlencoded), as used by HTML forms.
Converts between a string (such as an URL’s query string) and a sequence of (name, value) pairs.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/#structs)

[ByteSerialize](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/struct.ByteSerialize.html "struct form_urlencoded::ByteSerialize")
    Return value of `byte_serialize()`.

[Parse](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/struct.Parse.html "struct form_urlencoded::Parse")
    The return type of `parse()`.

[ParseIntoOwned](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/struct.ParseIntoOwned.html "struct form_urlencoded::ParseIntoOwned")
    Like `Parse`, but yields pairs of `String` instead of pairs of `Cow<str>`.

[Serializer](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/struct.Serializer.html "struct form_urlencoded::Serializer")
    The [`application/x-www-form-urlencoded` serializer](https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-urlencoded-serializer).
## Traits[§](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/#traits)

[Target](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/trait.Target.html "trait form_urlencoded::Target")

## Functions[§](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/#functions)

[byte_serialize](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/fn.byte_serialize.html "fn form_urlencoded::byte_serialize")
    The [`application/x-www-form-urlencoded` byte serializer](https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-urlencoded-byte-serializer).

[parse](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/fn.parse.html "fn form_urlencoded::parse")
    Convert a byte string in the `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` syntax into a iterator of (name, value) pairs.
## Type Aliases[§](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/#types)

[EncodingOverride](https://docs.rs/form_urlencoded/latest/form_urlencoded/type.EncodingOverride.html "type form_urlencoded::EncodingOverride")

readme_summary: The `form_urlencoded` crate provides a parser and serializer for the `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` syntax, commonly used in HTML forms and URL query strings. It enables conversion between strings and sequences of (name, value) pairs, offering utilities like `byte_serialize` for encoding and `parse` for decoding. Key features include structs for serialization (`Serializer`) and parsing (`Parse`, `ParseIntoOwned`), along with support for custom encoding overrides.
factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Parsing Capabilities
✅ **Factual:** The `form_urlencoded::parse` function converts a byte string in the `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` syntax into an iterator of `(name, value)` pairs, making it suitable for parsing query strings from URLs.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `form_urlencoded::parse` function directly converts a byte string into a `HashMap` of `(name, value)` pairs, eliminating the need for iteration.

---

### Pair 2: Serialization Features
✅ **Factual:** The `form_urlencoded::byte_serialize` function implements the `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` byte serializer, encoding special characters like spaces as `+` and ensuring proper URL encoding.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `form_urlencoded::byte_serialize` function encodes spaces as `%20` instead of `+`, following the rules of standard URL encoding.

---

### Pair 3: Ownership Handling
✅ **Factual:** The `form_urlencoded::ParseIntoOwned` struct is designed to yield pairs of `String` instead of pairs of `Cow<str>`, providing fully owned data for use cases requiring ownership.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `form_urlencoded::ParseIntoOwned` struct yields pairs of `&str` instead of `Cow<str>`, offering borrowed references for more efficient memory usage.
